cluster_relations.rel_desc: A smile is listed as one of the facial expressions.
Frowns are categorized as facial expressions.
Raised eyebrows are treated as a type of facial expression.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject is a more specific type or subtype within the category denoted by the object.
args.justification: In all three relations, the subject (smile, frowns, raised eyebrows) is described as a type of the object category (facial expressions). This is a taxonomic subtype relationship, so a single canonical predicate 'is_subtype_of' fits all.
These relations express membership of a more specific category within a broader category (types of facial expressions), which is best captured as a taxonomic hierarchy class.
Subtype/category relations are hierarchical, organizing concepts from general (facial expressions) to specific (smile, frowns, raised eyebrows).
